alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 13 at 5:32PM EDT until September 13 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds have built wave heights into the 3 to 6 foot range this evening. Dangerous waves and currents will be present through sunset at beaches from Grand Haven southward down the shoreline. North sides of north piers will be the most dangerous places to swim, namely Holland State Park and North Beach at South Haven.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
